alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 3:30AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 85 mph near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 to 80 mph near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge. * WHERE...South Washington Cascade Foothills. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For elevations above 1500 feet, light snow will be possible at times on Friday, but accumulation will be less than 1-2 inches. For elevations below 1500 feet, the timing of accumulating snow onset has pushed back to early Saturday morning as the weather system track has shifted south. There may be snow flurries in occasional showers on Friday with no accumulating snow. Snow amounts will depend on how quickly accumulating snow begins on Saturday and diminishes early Sunday morning, which remains uncertain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
